We have seen something similar in the past but have never been able to
duplicate. We certainly can't think of anything that we have added recently
which would cause something like this. 

It would be great if you could answer a couple of questions to help us out:

1. have you run any cvs commands outside of Eclipse (e.g. command line client)
2. what version have you migrated to RC3a from? (M5, RC2...)
3. Would it be possible to send the following file.
$WORKSPACE/.metadata/.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.projects\$PROJECT_WITH_BAD_ENTRIES\.syncinfo

Thanks.

1> no i never use other cvs clients. 
2> That's a bit difficult because i upgrade once in 1 or 2 weeks, so i use also 
integration builds. And i don't know exactly when i begun but if i have to 
guess then it is between 10-14 days.
3> i will attache the file. It is the dir j2db/build dir that constantly adds a 
d to the line where CVS complains about with an update.

Created an attachment (id=4307)
the sync info file

Thanks for the file. At first glance it looks like your .syncinfo file is
corrupt somehow. Could you try something else to verify that this is the source
of the problem:

1. quit eclipse and rename your .syncinfo file to .syncinfo.old
2. restart eclipse and run your update command and see if the problem still exists

if this doesn`t solve the problem try,

1. checkout your project as another project name (e.g. use Checkout As).
2. next run an update command and see if the problem still exists in that new
local copy of the project

I want to isolate the problem to the .syncfile. If this solves the problem we
will have to find out how your .syncfile got corrupt and how a side effect
resulted in a 'd' was printed to your Entries file.
Thanks.
Also, was there anything pring to the .log file?

here i have both in a zip

Thanks Johan,

We have verified that this is a migration issue. In I20030218 we released a
change that broke your workspace file. In RC1 this was fixed. The workaround for
this problem is to delete the .syncinfo files or start from a clean workspace. I
guess this is what happens when you are always on the bleeding edge :)

Closing, but I have opened a PR to improve servicing in the read/write of sync info:
see bug 35587
*** Bug 35482 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
